name: Niall Horan
description:
'''Niall James Horan''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|n|aɪ|ə|l|_|ˈ|h|ɔːr|ən}} {{respell|NY|əl|_|HOR|ən}};{{cbignore}} born 13 September 1993) is an Irish singer-songwriter. He rose to prominence as a member of the boy band [[One Direction]], formed in 2010 on the singing competition ''[[The X Factor (British TV series)|The X Factor]]''. The group released five albums and went on to become one of the best-selling [[boy band]]s of all time. 

After the band declared a hiatus in 2016, Horan signed a recording deal as a solo artist with [[Capitol Records]]. He has since released three albums: ''[[Flicker (album)|Flicker]]'' (2017), ''[[Heartbreak Weather]]'' (2020), and ''[[The Show (Niall Horan album)|The Show]]'' (2023). ''Flicker'' debuted at No. 1 in Ireland and the US, and reached the top three in Australia and the UK. The album's first two singles, "[[This Town (Niall Horan song)|This Town]]" and "[[Slow Hands (Niall Horan song)|Slow Hands]]", reached the top 20 in several countries. ''Heartbreak Weather'' was released in March 2020, and debuted at No. 1 in the UK, [[Ireland]] and Mexico, and at No. 4 in the US.

Horan released his third studio album, ''[[The Show (Niall Horan album)|The Show]]'', in June 2023, after dropping the singles "[[Heaven (Niall Horan song)|Heaven]]" in February and "[[Meltdown (Niall Horan song)|Meltdown]]" in April.
